'Why did they run from the police?': 20 years after two French teens' deaths, the question is as relevant as ever
subhead: For many people of color, fleeing a police stop has become a reflex. Sociologists say this risky behavior stems from the rise in incidents of police violence.

Lithuania closes its border with Belarus
subhead: The Baltic state condemned a violation of its airspace after dozens of helium-filled balloons launched from Belarus forced Vilnius Airport to close four times in recent days.

headline: Trump and Takaichi swap praise for 'new golden age of ties' between Japan and the US
subhead: Sanae Takaichi, Japan's first female prime minister, lavished praise on Donald Trump, adding that she will nominate him for a Nobel Peace Prize. Trump said he would like to 'realize a new golden age of the US-Japan alliance.'

headline: Three exhibitions in Paris celebrate 100 years of Art Deco
subhead: To mark the centenary of the International Exhibition of Modern Decorative and Industrial Arts, three venues are showcasing a leading figure of the movement, the archives of a renowned trunk-maker and contemporary creations.

headline: Southern Syria's Sweida sees Druze and Bedouin communities locked in hatred
subhead: Several hundred members of both communities were taken prisoner during the clashes that erupted between them in July. Three months later, the majority are still captives, further fueling the conflict.

subhead: Since parting ways with Trump in June, the world's richest man has refocused on his companies, delighting his investors.

headline: Mohammed Shia al-Sudani, the 'builder' seeking to safeguard Iraq's fragile stability
subhead: As the November 11 legislative election approaches, Iraqi Prime Minister Mohammed Shia al-Sudani, who's running for a second term, has been working to keep his country out of escalating regional tensions.

headline: Mouhamadou Fall, first French athlete to join Enhanced Games: 'For me, it's not doping, but a chance to learn more about the human body's limits'
subhead: The French sprinter announced Thursday that he has signed up for the Enhanced Games, an event where doping is permitted – even encouraged. In an interview with Le Monde, the multiple French champion in the 100 m and 200 m explains his decision.
